sources.data_found: The Star HPC cluster leverages NVIDIA HGX-based systems with A100 and H100 GPUs, AMD EPYC processors, a resilient storage system with high-speed SSDs, and an ultra-high-throughput, low latency InfiniBand network fabric to deliver exceptional computational power for data intensive research.
The compute nodes feature high-end H100 and A100 GPUs, AMD EPYC and Intel Xeon processors, and over 7 Terabytes of combined RAM. The cluster runs SLURM.

MRI: Track 1 Acquisition of an HPC Cluster for Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Scientific Computing, and Interdisciplinary Research. A high-performance computing (HPC) cluster is being built through a collaborative endeavor to support computation- and data-intensive applications at Hofstra University, Adelphi University, and Nassau Community College.
Adelphi's total enrollment in 2024–2025 was 7,603 students, who joined us from 43 states and 72 countries.
For the academic year 2023-2024, total of 7,406 students have enrolled in Adelphi University with 5,124 undergraduate and 2,282 graduate students.

During the 2021-2022 academic year, Adelphi University handed out 42 bachelor's degrees in computer & information sciences. In 2022, 11 students received their master's degree in computer & information sciences from Adelphi.

student_data.notes: Based on degree completion data from 2021-2022: 42 bachelor's degrees in CS (estimated 168 undergrads based on 4-year program), 11 master's degrees (estimated 44 grad students based on 2-year program). PhD count not found. Note: These are estimates based on graduation rates, as current enrollment by major was not publicly available.

gpu_resources.notes: Adelphi University shares access to the Star HPC cluster at Hofstra University through an NSF-funded collaboration. The cluster features NVIDIA HGX-based systems with both A100 and H100 GPUs, but specific GPU counts are not publicly disclosed. The $1.5M cluster serves Hofstra, Adelphi, and Nassau Community College. Exact GPU model counts marked as -1 (not found) as the documentation confirms presence of H100 and A100 GPUs but does not specify quantities.

analysis_notes: Adelphi University has shared access to the Star HPC cluster at Hofstra through NSF grant. While A100 and H100 GPUs are confirmed, specific counts are not publicly available. Student data based on degree completions rather than current enrollment.
